title.text: Language Specific Issue and Feature Exploration in Chinese Event Extraction

entities.text: Feature Exploration in Chinese Event Extraction

abstractContent.text: In this paper, we present a Chinese event extraction system.

We point out a language specific issue in Chinese trigger labeling, and then commit to discussing the contributions of lexical, syntactic and semantic features applied in trigger labeling and argument labeling.
As a result, we achieved competitive performance , specifically, F-measure of 59.9 in trigger labeling and F-measure of 43.8 in argument labeling.

introductionContent.text: In this paper we address the event extraction task defined in Automatic Content Extraction (ACE) program.

The ACE program defines the following terminology for event extraction task: 񮽙 Trigger: the word that most clearly expresses an event's occurrence 񮽙 Argument: an entity, or a temporal expression or a value that plays a certain role in the event instance 񮽙 Event mention: a phrase or sentence with a distinguished trigger and participant arguments Some English event extraction systems based on supervised learning have been reported by researchers.

introductionContent.text: In this paper we developed a modularized Chinese event extraction system.
We nicely handled the language specific issue in trigger labeling and explored effective lexical, syntactic and semantic features that were applied in trigger labeling and argument labeling.
